byline.contributor: Michael S. Schmidt reported from Charlotte, and Matt Apuzzo from Washington.
byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and MATT APUZZO

abstract: Federal Judge David C Keesler sentences David H Petraeus to two years' probation for providing classified information to former mistress Paula Broadwell while he was director of Central Intelligence Agency; also fines him $100,000, $60,000 more than government's suggested fine.
lead_paragraph: The former C.I.A. director and general in Iraq and Afghanistan was given two years’ probation, which was a disappointment for F.B.I. officials, and a higher-than-expected $100,000 fine.

headline.main: David Petraeus Is Sentenced to Probation in Leak Investigation
headline.print_headline: Petraeus Receives Probation for Giving Information to Lover

snippet: The former C.I.A. director and general in Iraq and Afghanistan was given two years’ probation, which was a disappointment for F.B.I. officials, and a higher-than-expected $100,000 fine.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
